issue.title: Use a more stable and precise physics engine for the Atlas simulation, preferably based on a Featherstone algorithm

content.raw:
As a result of our collaboration with @sherm1 and other folks at Stanford, we've made a lot of progress on integrating the [Simbody](https://simtk.org/home/simbody) physics engine, which employs a Featherstone formulation.  Experimental Simbody support was recently [merged](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/716) into Gazebo, allowing you to build Gazebo from source against an existing Simbody installation.  We're able to make Atlas walk in Gazebo using Simbody, e.g.:

* http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x4LbbfqWmIU
* http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T1Y8kXmKhvE

We're currently working on some performance issues related to contact modeling.  We invite intrepid developers to try out the experimental Simbody support in Gazebo.

On a related note, the Bullet physics engine has been mostly integrated, though we have some remaining [issues](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues?component=physics::BulletPhysics&status=open&status=new) to tie up.  Along the way, we identified a couple of issues that had to be fixed upstream in Bullet itself.
